item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

What will you do? 

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-05-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-28-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

New York, New York, United States of America

City:

USA-NY-NEW YORK

item.title: Manager, Credit Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Credit Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This is a highly technical role requiring hands-on experience with data and decisioning tools to provide support to the credit strategy partners to execute direct marketing campaigns and initiatives. This role will continuously challenge and seek to improve the efficiency and accuracy of risk eligible rules and strategy implementation design and processes utilizing new technologies and data sources.

What will you do?

  • Design, build, and test strategy changes in various platforms to ensure flawless implementation
  • Complete quality assurance audits to ensure the design & build has been accurately interpreted to meets the business need
  • Strong in data analysis and data sciences
  • Develops clearly written documentation for strategy changes that are tailored to different audiences including business groups, QA, IT and senior management
  • Seeks opportunities to utilize RBC data sources to develop automation of execution and testing activities. Identifies and implements new methods or processes to shorten the execution cycle or to reduce costs
  • Ensure that strategy implementation standard methodology and best practices are implemented in day to day routines

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 3+ years expertise in relational database marketing and structured programming concepts, including the use of data analytics and decisioning tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, SPARK)
  • 3+ years’ experience in application of experimental design
  • Strong data analytical skillsets and mind-set
  • Strong project management, time management and implementation skills
  • Strong problem resolution and decision-making skills
  • Strong written/oral communication skills to develop and convey thoughtful and insightful explanations

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions to monitor operational performance, present insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing their business
  • Source data from various platforms and build automated data pipelines
  • Lead conversations with business partners to solicit requirements and project feedback
  • Apply standard design principles and advanced data visualization techniques to provide actionable insights
  • Test and validate new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed

Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence is hiring a Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

item.title: Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Drive the reduction of internal manual reports and processes either through automation or consolidation of existing reporting processes.
  • Provide adhoc requests and solutions as well as time sensitive break/fix requests to the satisfaction of our partners.
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to adhoc and break/fix solutions for future reference
  • Communicate and consult with partners across Canadian Banking Operations in order to provide support, insight, gather feedback, and communicate project statuses
  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand our business processes and objectives in order to define/recommend automating existing manual reporting solutions to meet those objectives
  • Be a thought partner within the Reporting COE team, supporting the development of insights, implementing best practices, and providing mentorship to team members


What do you need to succeed?


Must-have

  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed


Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities


What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Business Intelligence is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

item.title: Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will support the Senior Director- Physical Distribution Planning and Senior Manager, Physical Network & Distribution Analytics and Planning by transforming usable data and analytics into high-level insights to inform market presence and coverage initiatives.  You will also look for opportunities for efficiency and effectiveness in reporting and presentation templates.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for data management and maintenance of unique databases of the RBC Branch Network along with competitors branch network across Canada
  • Supports in the development of planning templates and processes , and identifies opportunities to improve the capabilities and output of such templates, automating where possible
  • Conducts ongoing research and analysis to study the impact of changing client behavior and migration across channels  
  • Leveraging internal and external data to improve the capabilities of the group
  • Responsible for the prioritization and delivery of reporting requests from across PC&B supporting branch, client patterns and locations
  • Responsible for executing scoring and segmentation models and sharing results with Planning Team for downstream feedback for investment prioritization
  • Responsible for developing/updating tableau reporting views shared with PNS and P&CB
  • Responsible for all reporting requests  including generation, distribution and archival to support PNS and regional banking relative to branch network, ATM locations

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical capabilities and ability to clearly formulate/articulate findings to stakeholders and senior management
  • Experience with GIS
  • Expertise with Alteryx and experience in reporting and presenting insights via Tableau
  • Familiarity with data manipulation programming languages such as SQL and SAS/R
  • Expert Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

Requirements include:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

Job Summary

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the TM1 models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners

item.title: Senior Associate - Data Analytics (Jersey)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Associate - Data Analytics (Jersey)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will work closely with business and technology teams across Wealth Management International (WMI) to support the delivery of analytical insights, develop and curate data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data driven decisions.

What will you do?

  • Develop, enhance and maintain the evolving Data Analytics data infrastructure in line with the business needs to support the overarching data strategy across the organization
  • Identify, source, stage and model data using industry standard technologies and established development and operational practices as part of the end-to-end data lifecycle
  • Work with the business to identify and source data points across core platforms and processes for inclusion within the Data Analytics data repository
  • Ability to structure large disparate data sets to serve multiple functions and tailor the results for specific audiences, creating models to support investigation and analysis
  • Ability to create new and modify existing T-SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages to support new and regular reporting requirements
  • Research, explore and understand business problems and reporting requirements to facilitate the design, development and deployment of solutions and dashboards, enabling end-user self-service, incorporating drill-down functionality
  • Provide data driven and thought provoking insights to drive informed decision-making, transferring knowledge to stakeholders and enabling the business to use its data more effectively
  • Through the delivery of informative reporting solutions; support, inspire and educate end-users to use data more effectively to improve overarching data literacy across the organization
  • Analyse, document and recommend improvements to existing business practices to capitalise on opportunities for automation, efficiencies and risk reduction to enhance capabilities and streamline end-to-end data related processes
  • Responsible for the design, development and ongoing maintenance of the scalable Data Analytics data infrastructure using the Microsoft SQL technology stack to serve as the foundational layer for analytics and insights, support and guide team on technical design and implementations

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience with MS SQL Server
  • Sound understanding of relational database principals, guidelines and design
  • Extensive SQL query development experience
  • Familiarity and experience with data visualisation tools
  • Data management specialist with ability to mine data and predictive modelling
  • Advanced knowledge of, and experience in manipulating large disparate data sets from multiple sources in multiple formats

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Experience with GitHub
  • Knowledge of Agile project management principles
  • Knowledge of R and Python

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible working options fully supported

item.title: Head of Client Analytics & CRM
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Head of Client Analytics & CRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This role will be responsible for driving the strategy and implementation of Client Data Initiatives and projects interfacing with senior business stakeholders across Capital Markets. Manages a portfolio of products and programs leading a team of directors, senior managers, and managers by providing financial and people resource guidance.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for All aspects of running a 100+ person team comprised of technologists - data engineers & full stack developers, business/data analysts, and user experience designers
  • CM Client Analytics – Managing multiple client analytics environments that consume data from 80+ internal and external source systems. Deep understanding of core reference data (sales teams, Client hierarchies, Sales Coverage, Roles personas and entitlements). Experience in understanding Client KPIs (revenue, profitability, resource consumption)
  • CM CRM Technology – Leading the application development team aligned to the CM Salesforce implementation and coordinating relationship management with that vendor on behalf of CM (Project Planning, Coordination & Execution:
  • Driving Implementation Strategy, Identifying risks, scoping, finding & recommending solutions Task-based scheduling, resource management, managing budgets & financial planning Managing large initiatives and taking them to implementation Strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities Tracking metrics and project performance Dealing with changes, issues, conflicts
  • Manage senior stakeholder relationships pertaining to all areas of responsibility listed above and ensure that employees understand RBC vision, as well as support and reinforce targeted behaviors that contribute to RBC goals
  • Leverage the value in unit, department, and enterprise-wide teams to develop better solutions and achieve a cross enterprise mindset
  • Successfully execute change while supporting employees through the process and keeping them focused on business priorities
  • Self-managed and results-oriented with sense of ownership Excellent oral and written communications skills Organizational skills needed to handle multiple, parallel assignments Effective in a team setting as well as in individual capacity The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and to high-priority business users

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • 15+ years of experience in Capital markets with detailed knowledge spanning trading and banking, multiple asset classes, and multiple regions
  • 15+ years of experience with enterprise data and analytics technologies with track record of leading & successfully delivery of data and analytics solutions in a capital markets domain context, specifically client data analytics domain
  • Extensive experience leading and managing data and analytics solution in both private and public cloud environments
  • Ability to engage senior level commercial and technical stakeholders Proven track record as a people manager running large teams
  • Strong financial acumen and demonstrated track record of managing annual budgets of $10MM+ Strong command of a banks control infrastructure, IT risk surface, and regulatory framework
  • Articulate communicator who can make the complex simple speaking to technical and commercial audiences, Strong collaborator with demonstrated track record of partnering across an organization and leading by sphere of influence

Project Management Requirements

  • Ability to manage expectations of Senior Management (Head of Sales, Head of Client Management, Head of Capital Markets) Articulation skills a must when managing Senior stakeholders Construct and administer project plans Provide detail status reports and be accountable for highly visible projects

Technical Requirements

  • Expert in a range of different data and analytics technologies Strong command of data modelling and engineering in a CM domain context Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong interpersonal skills, teamwork experience
  • Excellent business analysis, data analysis and user experience design skills

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-09-22-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-31-07:00

item.title: Associate Director, Wholesale Capital Measurement & Analytics, FRO
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Wholesale Capital Measurement & Analytics, FRO

Job Description

  • Responsible for calculating regulatory capital requirements for RBC’s wholesale portfolios (under Basel III/IRB and Basel II/STD Floor) in compliance with OSFI CAR guidelines, internal policies and other mandated protocols. Including maintenance of robust processes, policies and procedures to ensure accuracy of capital calculations
  • Develop and enhance capital measurement validation approaches along with supporting the execution of challenges related to capital measurement and management processes, including forecasting methodologies, assumptions/inputs, governance, results, and business decisions
  • Play an important role in production and submission of critical internal and external disclosers and regulatory filings such as RBC’s Basel Capital Adequacy Requirements (BCAR) reporting to OSFI, Pillar 3, NCR, etc. while ensuring ongoing integrity of capital calculation and reporting processes
  • Develop extensive knowledge of the capital data domain, lineages and controls to enable development of better capital review and analytical tools
  • Define, develop, and continuously enhance attribution and other analytics that can effectively demonstrate exposure, EAD and RWA calculations. This analysis will include variance analysis period over period are explained (with attribution to exposure and risk factor changes) in a reliable and transparent manner
  • Provide analytical and domain advisory on advanced and complex regulatory capital calculations and risk methodologies. Including supporting business teams across the organization to better understand and optimize drivers of credit risk capital specific to their portfolios
  • Collaborate with stakeholders including line of business, risk, finance, IT, and data teams to ensure accuracy of capital measurement calculations. Also provide thought leadership and requirements for analytics that further enhances transparency to the overall RWA calculations and reporting process.
  • Work with various stakeholders such as GRM credit adjudication, Parameter Estimation, and Stress testing teams to successfully implement wholesale credit risk models and parameters as per OSFI and Basel prescribed regulatory guidelines.
  • Identify and drive execution of RWA optimization opportunities by collaborating with business partners including line of business, risk, legal and finance teams to ensure capital charges are calculated and optimized per approved policies, guidelines and applicable regulatory framework
  • Develop and provide value-added analysis including scenario and sensitivity analysis to drive effective and optimized capital measurement specific to various aspects of RBC’s wholesale portfolio. Also, provide portfolio specific impacts/views to drive senior management decision making.
  • Participate in Quantitative Impact Studies (QIS) of proposed regulatory framework changes, effectively communicating the impacts and helping business stakeholders formulate strategies to transition to new requirements, and working with IT teams to implement changes to complex capital system architecture.  
  • Participate in capital measurement and reporting reviews conducted by control functions such as audit, SOX office, risk management etc. Provide the necessary subject matter expertise and evidences to demonstrate robustness and accuracy of RWA calculation and reporting processes
  • Manage and address RWA reviews by other control functions such as Internal Audit, Independent Compliance Risk Management, Capital Planning Review Group etc. and feedback if any, are remediated in an appropriate and timely manner
  • Identify potential process improvements and capabilities to increase consistency, transparency, and reliability of RWA calculation, governance and controls processes
  • Provide detailed/technical analysis of the impact of new or changing regulations and develop options for potential advocacy work with external stakeholders such CBA, OSFI, BCBS, etc
  • Play a key role in the rollout and stabilization of FRO’s new capital measurement tool (Axiom) by providing hands on subject matter advisory across complex topics related to measurement, reporting, and analytics
  • Act as an important resource in interpretation of new Basel IV CAR, Pillar 3, and NCR guidelines and effectively translating them into specific business and technical requirements for various IT and Vendor resources to work on
  • Provide subject matter expertise in helping IT and vendor resources to build sound business requirements, data analysis & mapping, business rules specification, and use cases development to ensure delivery of robust solutions to fulfill changing Basel regulatory requirements, audit concerns, business goal of capital optimization and credit risk capital analysis
  • Contribute towards defining and scoping use cases spanning various aspects related to capital measurement for wholesale products under BIV rules.  Done to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with pertinent policies, procedures, methodologies, and regulatory guidelines

Must-Have

  • Advanced academic qualification in fields of financial or risk management.
  • Deep understanding of banking products and application of pertinent regulatory capital rules (OSFI CAR & Basel guidelines) to exposure emanating from these products.
  • Deep understanding capital measurement and common capital attribution approaches.
  • Appreciation of concepts relating to consolidated and solo capital measurement
  • Authoritative leader capable of guiding solutions working in collaboration with cross-functional teams
  • Ability to think strategically and connect analysis to solutions and objectives
  • Ability to write and present succinct solutions 

Nice to Have

  • A professional accounting designation or a MBA with concentration in Finance
  • Good understanding of risk management & measurement approaches and common practices in a financial services context
  • Extensive experience in managing multiple views of capital in a large, multi-dimensional financial services institution
  • Up-to-date and understanding of concepts relating to Basel IV and leverage measurement along with experience in assessing the impacts of these on trading portfolios
  • Familiarity with OSFI advanced model approval process.

Job Summary

This is a subject matter role within the Capital Measurement team part Financial Resource Optimization (FRO) team.

In this role, the incumbent will be responsible for driving capital measurement related activities for RBC’s wholesale portfolios and supporting preparation of various RBC disclosures such RBC’s Basel Capital Adequacy Requirements (BCAR) reporting to OSFI, Pillar 3, NCR, etc. In addition to that, the incumbent will play a key role in driving and eventual implementation of some of the very complex and critical deliverables as part of FRO’s Axiom project and BIV implementation.

To effectively serve the mandate, the role will liaise and collaborate with key stakeholders across the Bank, including business, risk and finance teams, regulators, and Technology groups.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Office of the CFO

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-08-09-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-14-07:00
